DOC.brief_summary: The AML96 study examines the feasibility of a risk-adapted postremission treatment strategy including related and unrelated allogeneic stem cell transplantation for high risk AML patients and related allogeneic and autologous stem cell transplantation for standard risk AML patients in a multi-center setting. Furthermore it randomizes patients between intermediate-dose Cytarabine vs high-dose Cytarabine within the first postremission-course.
DOC.brief_title: AML96 - Risk-Adapted and Randomized Postremission-Therapy for Adult Acute Myeloid Leukemia Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The AML96 study examines the feasibility of a risk-adapted postremission treatment strategy including related and unrelated allogeneic stem cell transplantation for high risk AML patients and related allogeneic and autologous stem cell transplantation for standard risk AML patients in a multi-center setting. Furthermore it randomizes patients between intermediate-dose Cytarabine vs high-dose Cytarabine within the first postremission-course.
DOC.criteria: de novo or secondary acute myeloid leukemia of the FAB subtypes M0M2 and M4M7 de novo or secondary myelodysplastic syndrome FAB subtypes RAEB and RAEBT written informed consent severe comorbidities severe uncontrolled complications of the leukemia previous therapy of leukemia/MDS HIVInfection known relevant allergy against study medication pregnancy missing written informed consent
